page.title: 12Angling
page.content: 33% of our area is taken up with lakes or, as they are called 'lochs'. The two lochs in this area are a. the Stenness Loch and b. the Harray Loch. The Stenness Loch is an arm of the sea and is salt water. It is connected to the Harray Loch through a small channel but the Harray Loch is a fresh water loch. At one time the Stenness Loch was the most popular fishing loch. Sea trout and the occasional salmon were caught there. Today the best fishing loch is the Harray Loch where brown trout are caught. The Harray Loch is one of the best trout fishing lochs in the whole of Britain. Sometimes very large trout are caught, the biggest one weighing 7.5 kilograms.Flies and spinners are used to catch the trout. The Standing Stones and Merkister Hotels cater specially for angling holidays.
